messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

(Ti2N3)2(TiN2)3Ti12N13 crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three Ti12N13 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction; six Ti2N3 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction; and nine TiN2 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. In each Ti12N13 sheet, there are six inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(5) is bonded to three equivalent N(7) and three equivalent N(8) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 9°. All Ti(5)-N(7) bond lengths are 1.90 Å. All Ti(5)-N(8) bond lengths are 2.35 Å. In the second Ti site, Ti(6) is bonded to three equivalent N(8) and three equivalent N(9) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-9°. All Ti(6)-N(8) bond lengths are 2.08 Å. All Ti(6)-N(9) bond lengths are 2.15 Å. In the third Ti site, Ti(7) is bonded to three equivalent N(10) and three equivalent N(9) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(7)-N(10) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. All Ti(7)-N(9) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. In the fourth Ti site, Ti(8) is bonded to three equivalent N(10) and three equivalent N(11) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(8)-N(10) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. All Ti(8)-N(11) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. In the fifth Ti site, Ti(9) is bonded to three equivalent N(11) and three equivalent N(12) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(9)-N(11) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. All Ti(9)-N(12) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. In the sixth Ti site, Ti(10) is bonded to three equivalent N(12) and three equivalent N(13) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(10)-N(12) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. All Ti(10)-N(13) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. There are seven inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(7) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(5) atoms. In the second N site, N(8) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(5) and three equivalent Ti(6) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 3°. In the third N site, N(9) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(6) and three equivalent Ti(7) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-3°. In the fourth N site, N(10) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(7) and three equivalent Ti(8) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the fifth N site, N(11) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(8) and three equivalent Ti(9) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the sixth N site, N(12) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(10) and three equivalent Ti(9) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the seventh N site, N(13) is bonded to six equivalent Ti(10) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In each Ti2N3 sheet, Ti(1,2) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(1,2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. All Ti(1,2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.21 Å. There are three inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(1,2) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent Ti(1,2) atoms to form edge-sharing NTi6 octahedra. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(1,2) atoms. All N(3)-Ti(1,2) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. In each TiN2 sheet, Ti(3) is bonded to three equivalent N(4) and three equivalent N(5) atoms to form edge-sharing TiN6 octahedra. All Ti(3)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.00 Å. All Ti(3)-N(5) bond lengths are 2.01 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(4) is bonded in a distorted trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(3) atoms. In the second N site, N(5) is bonded in a distorted trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(3) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.309148623020831 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Ti2N is trigonal omega-like structured and crystallizes in the tetragonal I4_1/amd space group. Ti(1) is bonded in a T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. There is one shorter (2.05 Å) and two longer (2.07 Å) Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 9°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

Ti3N crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mmm space group. There are two inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(1) is bonded to four equivalent Ti(1), four equivalent Ti(2), and four equivalent N(1) atoms to form distorted TiTi8N4 cuboctahedra that share corners with twelve equivalent Ti(1)Ti8N4 cuboctahedra, edges with eight equivalent Ti(1)Ti8N4 cuboctahedra, edges with eight equivalent N(1)Ti12 cuboctahedra, faces with four equivalent N(1)Ti12 cuboctahedra, and faces with ten equivalent Ti(1)Ti8N4 cuboctahedra. All Ti(1)-Ti(1) bond lengths are 2.47 Å. All Ti(1)-Ti(2) bond lengths are 2.78 Å. All Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.78 Å. In the second Ti site, Ti(2) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to eight equivalent Ti(1) and four equivalent N(1) atoms. All Ti(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.47 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Ti(2) and eight equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form NTi12 cuboctahedra that share corners with four equivalent N(1)Ti12 cuboctahedra, edges with eight equivalent N(1)Ti12 cuboctahedra, edges with sixteen equivalent Ti(1)Ti8N4 cuboctahedra, faces with four equivalent N(1)Ti12 cuboctahedra, and faces with eight equivalent Ti(1)Ti8N4 cuboctahedra. All Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.61 Å. N(1) is bonded to twelve equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and face-sharing NTi12 cuboctahedra. Ti3N2 is Corundum structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R-3c space group. Ti(1) is bonded in a distorted rectangular see-saw-like geometry to four equivalent N(1) atoms. There are two shorter (2.07 Å) and two longer (2.13 Å) Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge, corner, and face-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-52°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

Ti3N2 crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mmc space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two Ti3N2 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.05 Å. In the second Ti site, Ti(2) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form edge-sharing TiN6 octahedra. All Ti(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.15 Å. N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Ti(1) and three equivalent Ti(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTi6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.513575089499998 eV/atom.

Ti3N4 crystallizes in the trigonal P31c space group. There are two inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(1) is bonded to one N(2), one N(4), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form corner-sharing TiN4 tetrahedra. The Ti(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.91 Å. The Ti(1)-N(4) bond length is 1.92 Å. Both Ti(1)-N(3) bond lengths are 1.94 Å. In the second Ti site, Ti(2) is bonded to one N(1), one N(3), and two equivalent N(4) atoms to form corner-sharing TiN4 tetrahedra. The Ti(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.92 Å. The Ti(2)-N(3) bond length is 1.91 Å. There is one shorter (1.91 Å) and one longer (1.95 Å) Ti(2)-N(4) bond length. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent Ti(2) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ti(1) atoms. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to one Ti(2) and two equivalent Ti(1) atoms. In the fourth N site, N(4) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to one Ti(1) and two equivalent Ti(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 1.7589000000000001 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.54274134160714 eV/atom.

Ti3N4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pnma space group. There are three inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(1) is bonded to one N(1), two equivalent N(3), and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 4-68°. The Ti(1)-N(1) bond length is 2.00 Å. Both Ti(1)-N(3) bond lengths are 1.96 Å. There are two shorter (2.17 Å) and one longer (2.27 Å) Ti(1)-N(2) bond length. In the second Ti site, Ti(2) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to one N(2), one N(3), two equivalent N(1), and three equivalent N(4) atoms. The Ti(2)-N(2) bond length is 2.58 Å. The Ti(2)-N(3) bond length is 2.05 Å. Both Ti(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. There are two shorter (1.97 Å) and one longer (2.09 Å) Ti(2)-N(4) bond length. In the third Ti site, Ti(3) is bonded to one N(3), one N(4), two equivalent N(1), and two equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 4-68°. The Ti(3)-N(3) bond length is 2.17 Å. The Ti(3)-N(4) bond length is 1.97 Å. Both Ti(3)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.08 Å. Both Ti(3)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.12 Å. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to one Ti(1), two equivalent Ti(2), and two equivalent Ti(3) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to one Ti(2), two equivalent Ti(3), and three equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form distorted NTi6 octahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(4)Ti4 tetrahedra, corners with three equivalent N(3)Ti4 trigonal pyramids, edges with four equivalent N(2)Ti6 octahedra, edges with two equivalent N(4)Ti4 tetrahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(3)Ti4 trigonal pyramids. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded to one Ti(2), one Ti(3), and two equivalent Ti(1) atoms to form distorted NTi4 trigonal pyramids that share corners with three equivalent N(2)Ti6 octahedra, corners with four equivalent N(4)Ti4 tetrahedra, corners with two equivalent N(3)Ti4 trigonal pyramids, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Ti6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 10-38°. In the fourth N site, N(4) is bonded to one Ti(3) and three equivalent Ti(2) atoms to form NTi4 tetrahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(2)Ti6 octahedra, corners with two equivalent N(4)Ti4 tetrahedra, corners with four equivalent N(3)Ti4 trigonal pyramids, edges with two equivalent N(2)Ti6 octahedra, and edges with two equivalent N(4)Ti4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 42°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

TiN is Molybdenum Carbide MAX Phase-like structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three TiN sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are fifteen inequivalent Ti sites. In the first Ti site, Ti(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.06 Å. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(5)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. All Ti(5)-N(5) bond lengths are 2.12 Å. In the sixth Ti site, Ti(6,7,8,16,17) is bonded to three equivalent N(5) and three equivalent N(6,8,15,17) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(6,7,8,16,17)-N(5) bond lengths are 2.12 Å. All Ti(6,7,8,16,17)-N(6,8,15,17) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. In the seventh Ti site, Ti(9,15,18) is bonded to three equivalent N(6,8,15,17) and three equivalent N(7,9,14,16) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(9,15,18)-N(6,8,15,17) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. All Ti(9,15,18)-N(7,9,14,16) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. In the eighth Ti site, Ti(10,14) is bonded to three equivalent N(10,11,12,13) and three equivalent N(7,9,14,16) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(10,14)-N(10,11,12,13) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. All Ti(10,14)-N(7,9,14,16) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. In the eleventh Ti site, Ti(13) is bonded to six equivalent N(10,11,12,13) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Ti(13)-N(10,11,12,13) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. In the twelfth Ti site, Ti(19) is bonded to three equivalent N(19) and three equivalent N(20) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TiN6 octahedra. TiN is Zincblende, Sphalerite structured and crystallizes in the cubic F-43m space group. Ti(1) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing TiN4 tetrahedra. TiN2 crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mcm space group. Ti(1) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Ti(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.20 Å.
